text: mr. shell is in Belgrade he was released
towards the end of 2014 on health
grounds who's been suffering from cancer
and it was decided in the end by The
Hague that he didn't have to go back to
the tribunal for the verdicts in terms
of the verdict coming as a shock to many
people but of course people are being
waiting for the verdict in this trial
for an awfully long time mr. shell
originally went to the Hague voluntarily
it has to be said when the indictment
was brought against him in 2003 that's
13 years ago and the trial actually
started in 2007 it's been through all
sorts of shenanigans since then and many
of those of mr. shells making and now
the court has found that he's not guilty
on all of those charges which were
largely relating to hate speech and
inciting ethnic Serb forces to kill or
displace people of other ethnic groups
we'll wait for mr. shells response which
I understand is expected in the course
of the afternoon I think he said he
wanted to say respond to the court's
decision but can you just give us a
little bit of context again guys to
where he fitted into the if you like the
this Serbian hierarchy at the time well
mr. shell was one of the people who
first came up with this idea or concept
of a greater Serbia or at least helped
to popularize it in the 1980s this idea
that that Yugoslavia or at least the
Serbs with the Nuka Slavia would be
better off forming a country in which
they took the areas in which serves
traditionally resided and made it into
one country which would be predominantly
ethnic Serb he was then involved allied
with slobodan milosevic in the early 90s
though the relationship between those
two went through many up and ups and
downs but again he was a prominent ultra
nationalist at the time espousing the
ethnic Serb course posing as a defender
of ethnic Serb people when they were
being put under threat in Croatia and in
Bosnia as he said it this is the
position mr. shell held it was indicted
for war crimes and crimes against
humanity the court found that he was
making speeches as a politician and that
he might have been making a political
stance that it wasn't a criminal stance
